column5: Was thinking of heading up, but have only been once before and can use some intel!
I'm betting that Monday will be the start of the better fishing. Was there last week, and caught a couple of cats
Heading there Sunday.  Been a few years since last time.  New law i think that came out last year that you cant fish closer then 25 meters to dam.  All dams on the grand apparently.  Is this true?

I think the rule you are referring to is not new, it's been around for a long time.  It is the second to last bullet on the bottom right side of page 8 of the current regs (snippit below).  There has always been a debate however whether a dam that is impassible to fish is considered an 'obstruction' or not as far as the intent of the rule goes.   The CO that I know insists that this rule is intended to protect fish that are trying to make their way upstream through a fish ladder or leap and that the if the dam is impassible, it's not a problem to fish there.  Many others do not share this opinion however.
Thanks for the info.   Cats are pretty much everywhere i think.  Guy i talked to at Fishmasters in Dunnville said it.
I was by yesterday, with all the rain the water at the dam looks like the US rapids above the Falls and the river is high and fast. I wait until the buds start on the trees to fish the river.
I have a couple buddies there this morning, just got one small cat so far
just heard from them again...they are on, getting into a few
First Dunnville cat caught today. 32.5 inches.  Love how it has its mouth open about to let out a roar lol.
if catfish weren't so gross I would call that one a beaut
